frame.name: Arithmetic_non-commutative
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame describes types of arithmetic operations and statements which are not commutative, i.e. the operation is uni-directional, e.g. subtraction and division. Because of the non-commutative nature, terms must be separated from each other in the form of <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen> instead of a combined Terms FE.</def-root>

FE.name: Term_1
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_1</fen> is the first operand in the non-commutative arithmetic that is modified by <fen>Term_2</fen> (e.g. subtracted or divided by <fen>Term_2</fen>).</def-root>

FE.name: Term_2
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_2</fen> is the second operand of the non-commutative arithmetic which modifies <fen>Term_1</fen> (e.g. subtracts from or divides <fen>Term_1</fen>).</def-root>
